pr_title: Enable multiple logins across teams by resetting the app

timeline.message: Add ability to clear preferences, db & PrivateKeyEntries

Enable checking if there are any unsynced events

- Provide boolean returns for delete operations
- Deprecate the logout() method in the SecureFragment since it's unsecure and we are providing a better method
- Add a method that returns the no of unsynced events
- Change the ResetAppUtil class to take in the application for which to clear data
Enable broadcasting sync upload progress
Enable broadcasting sync upload progress

Add configurable Pre-reset app checks & operations

- Move default event-client sync check for PreResetAppCheck class configuration
- Add CoreLibrary executors to handle default behaviour running on threads
- Add FetchStatus.fetchProgress enum
- Add logic to start reset-app process from a UI call
- Extend SyncService to be used for same-thread operations without pull from the server
- Add Contract to be used by the reset-app feature UI that handles progress, confirmation
Clear p2p tracking db during reset
Add tests for ResetAppUtil
Add tests for ResetAppUtil

Fix event-client sync not working before reset-app

- Move to login page once done logging out completely
- Cancel all jobs when resetting the app
- Fix event-client synced records check query
Delete p2p wal & shm file after deleting database
Fix event-client sync starting but crashes from NPE

Add Reset app progress dialog

- Enable clicking on cancel to cancel the quit process
Dismiss progress dialog when reset-app process is cancelled

Add check for unsynced structures

- Rename the PreResetSync to EventClientSync
- Unsubscribe from broadcast receiver after the event-client sync is complete
- Add repository method to count created structures not synced
- Enable syncing of structures in case they have not all been synced to the server
Add inherited WorkerThread annotations & cleanup

Add check for unsynced tasks

- Add repository method to check for unsynced tasks
- Add task sync to default pre-reset app checks
Extend created tasks check to check for unsynced task statuses
Add check for unsynced settings
Remove activity test
Merge branch 'master' into issue/483-enable-multiple-logins

Enable killing of services while syncing

- Code cleanup
- Remove imports
- Move strings to strings.xml

Refactor file locations for multi-tenant features

1. Add tests for the reset-app feature
2. Code cleanup
Merge branch 'master' into issue/483-enable-multiple-logins

Log the user deletion in crashlytics

- This will be updated later with a better strategy using Firebase Analytics Events OR what-was Fabric Answers
- Updated version to 1.10.3-SNAPSHOT

timeline.bodyText: There is already existing class org.smartregister.util.AppExecutors
timeline.author: githengi

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should be warning, if the intention is to send to crashlytics
timeline.author: githengi

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this can be a function for deleting journal, shm and wal
timeline.author: githengi

timeline.bodyText: This would leave the shm and wal which can lead to inconsistencies
timeline.author: githengi

replies.bodyText: I will change this to perform the other operations but return the correct status
replies.author: ekigamba

timeline.message:
Refactor code as-per code review

- Move functionality to delete db journal, wal & shm file to methods
- Use AppExecutor functionality
- Delete other DB files irrespective of the previous db file result

- Move functionality to delete db journal, wal & shm file to methods
- Use AppExecutor functionality
- Delete other DB files irrespective of the previous db file result

Refactor code as-per code review

- Move functionality to delete db journal, wal & shm file to methods
- Use AppExecutor functionality
- Delete other DB files irrespective of the previous db file result
Code cleanup

Plugin clear-app data to current logout functionality

- This functionality will be enabled when the SyncConfiguration#shouldClearDataOnLogout() returns true

Plugin clear-app data to current logout functionality

- This functionality will be enabled when the SyncConfiguration#shouldClearDataOnLogout() returns true
Fix failing tests
Fix failing tests
Merge branch 'master' into issue/483-enable-multiple-logins

Move clear data feature to login with different team/location

- If the user is not within the same group ID & the reset-app data configuration is true, the app will show a dialog asking the user if the are sure they want to clear data. It will then perform the process and try to relogin with the same username/password
Remove sdk min & target in core-library AndroidManifest.xml
Update ResetAppHelper tests
Move clear data dialog strings to strings.xml
Change user message during logout
Change user message during logout
Retrigger codacy
